metadata.synopsis: Minthara is being psychically tortured in the Moonrise Tower dungeon, having been sent there for failing in her mission to capture the weapon the Absolute was seeking (the Orpheus artefact).Two guards are torturing her, but they do not lay a finger on her. Instead, they have stripped away her psychic defenses and are using mind-melds to destroy her from the inside.The player can free her by killing the guards, or by mind-melding with Minthara and pulling her out of the despair. If she is freed from the mind-meld while the guards are alive, she kills them.The player can also destroy Minthara completely, by telepathically lobotomising her inside her own mind.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter Act 2 on the 'Absolute' path, in which the tieflings were killed. Go to Moonrise towers, and enter the execution scene in the audience chamber. Speak up for Minthara and advise Ketheric to keep her alive.Once this is done, head down to the dungeon and find her to trigger this torture scene.

12.speaker: Questioner Sumera
12.text: You were adored, Minthara. Brought up from the darkness, and into the Absolute's light.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing over Minthara, speaking serenely and calmly, like a priest giving the last rites, in horrible contrast to the words she's saying

147.speaker: Questioner Jasin
147.text: She cherished you. But it wasn't enough - you were distracted by your own desires.

154.speaker: Questioner Jasin
154.text: And most damning of all, an unexpected weakness - a longing for acceptance, and affection. From a mortal.

133.speaker: Questioner Jasin
133.text: A mortal who disappointed you in ways the Absolute never would.

146.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: First phrase delivered to torturer Jasin - pained gasp 'hnngnn' is simultaneous with Jasin touching a finger to their temple as they intensify the psychic assaultNodeContext: Through gritted teeth, holding back immense mental agony - cut off abruptly by a wave of psychic agony, which she reacts to with a pained grunt/sob

136.speaker: Questioner Jasin
136.text: And most damning of all, an inability to follow orders.

20.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
20.text: I obeyed to the best of my ability.
20.context: NodeContext: Through gritted teeth, holding back immense mental agony

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *The drow reaches out to you psychically, connecting with you for a moment. She is infected, like you, and her mind is disintegrating.*

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *Minthara's mind connects with yours. Not strong, as you remember it, but fractured... disintegrating.*

153.speaker: Questioner Sumera
153.text: Come to observe, True Soul? She is a lesson - none can rise so high that they cannot fall again.
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turning from Minthara to player, having noticed their approach

186.speaker: Player
186.text: What are you doing to her?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Yes - I'm looking forward to watching her break.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I expected her to be dismembered. Disappointing.

106.speaker: Questioner Sumera
106.text: When the body suffers, we retreat into the mind. But when the mind breaks, all is lost.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I've been instructed to handle this prisoner myself.

150.speaker: Questioner Jasin
150.text: Peace, sister. Let us observe the True Soul's methods - perhaps we can learn from them.

39.speaker: Questioner Jasin
39.text: Her mind is yours. Break it.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: they stand back from Minthara at the end of this line

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Reach out for the drow's mind.

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *Immediately, your mind is swept into a greater vortex. A psionic storm with Minthara at its centre.*
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player mindmelds. Minthara cowers in the same spot, but around her the room blurs like a purple vignette. It is as if she cowers alone, oppressed

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *Her torturers are not dominating her - they are destroying her mental defences, and exposing her to the presence that claims to be the Absolute.*

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Push past the presence, towards Minthara.

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *The presence pushes back against your intrusion, expanding to occupy every inch of Minthara's mind - until you are forced out.*
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision of the mindscape fades, and player grimaces in pain as they come back to reality

13.speaker: Questioner Sumera
13.text: Weak. You shouldn't have interfered with our work.

185.speaker: Questioner Jasin
185.text: The drow's mind is resilient, even now. Do not be ashamed that you could not break it.

64.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
64.text: None of you will break me.
64.context: NodeContext: weakening, but still with inner resolve

173.speaker: Questioner Sumera
173.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds her hand forward, palm upright, and closes her fingers, as she exerts mental energyNodeContext: Shouted

98.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: clutches her head in agonyNodeContext: agonised gasp

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Shatter her mind. Carve it apart.

187.speaker: Questioner Jasin
187.text: What is this - pity? Rebellion? Blasphemy? Stand down, or we will put you down.
187.context: NodeContext: shock and fury, with heavy emphasis on 'blasphemy'

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I'm putting a stop to this.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I don't know what came over me. I am loving your work.

23.speaker: Questioner Jasin
23.text: I don't know who you are, True Soul, but under General Thorm's command everybody has their duties. Learn yours, and stick to them.

57.speaker: Questioner Sumera
57.text: And we will stick to ours. Goodbye, Minthara.
57.context: NodeContext: ignoring the argument next to her and focusing on the prisoner - gloating

157.context: CinematicNodeContext: Torturer Sister holds her hands in front of her, and traces a triangle in the air, then raises her hands. Minthara stands as she raises them, like a marionette with invisible strings.

166.speaker: Questioner Sumera
166.text: Hello, Minthara. How do you feel?

134.speaker: Questioner Jasin
134.text: Excellent. A job well done, sister.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Push past the presence, towards Minthara.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Push past the presence, towards Minthara.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Acknowledge the presence - ask it to let you pass.

158.speaker: Narrator
158.text: *At your familiar touch, the presence withdraws. Still there, you sense, but letting you pass. Waiting.*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Navigating the storm, you reach the nexus of her mind. It is a wound, bleeding raw emotion and shattered memories. But she senses your arrival.*
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player steps through to join Minthara at the centre - the 'psionic border' dissipates.

88.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
88.text: You came. I prayed that you would, but there are no gods left to me.
88.context: NodeContext: feeling a glimmer of hope, despite the terrible situation you're in - speaking to your lover

144.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
144.text: This thing, that speaks inside me - it has all but destroyed me. But... it fears you.

163.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
163.text: Even so, I cannot resist it while my tormentors live.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: That thing is your precious Absolute - what it truly sounds like.

78.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
78.text: Whatever it is, I sense it, somewhere below - furious, and hungry.
78.context: NodeContext: We've told her something devastating - she's rattled, but had her suspicions (next line is her snapping herself out of it)

120.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
120.text: Quickly. Kill them - we must leave.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Share my strength, and strike the guards down.

35.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
35.text: I didn't dare hope... I owe you more than my life.

113.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
113.text: But first, let's make these bastards bleed.

189.speaker: Narrator
189.text: *Her mind fills with warmth, and she gently releases you.*
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: The mindscape fades, and the player snaps back to reality, where Minthara has risen to her feet, ready to attack the guards

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I have a plan - fake obedience, and the guards will leave without raising the alarm.

110.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
110.text: I would prefer to make these bastards bleed, but I trust that you speak from caution rather than cowardice.

73.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
73.text: I will put my faith in you, and pretend to be their slave.

168.speaker: Questioner Jasin
168.text: Is it done? I did not feel her mind break.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Because I reshaped her. If it is breaking you desire, I can snap you like a twig.

83.speaker: Questioner Sumera
83.text: N-no! My sister only meant to compliment your delicate work.

140.speaker: Questioner Jasin
140.text: Indeed. Seems I have a bit to learn, yet.

105.speaker: Questioner Jasin
105.text: We ought to return to our posts, sister. There'll be plenty more prisoners to practice on.

81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara watches them leave with disgust.

107.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
107.text: An ill thing, to let an enemy show their back and live.

161.speaker: Player
161.text: Let it go. You can plot your revenge once we're free.

14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
14.text: Prudent. Let us go, then - I will be your mute and faithful slave. For now.
14.context: NodeContext:  'Prudent' is not a compliment. But she relents - a little sarcastically

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Seems to me it's back-stabbing that got you where you are.

28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
28.text: And look at you, right here with me. I suggest we leave - silently.

117.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
117.text: Not an instant longer than I must. Make haste.

2.speaker: Questioner Sumera
2.text: Tsk, Minthara. A good little servant does not sulk.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: She is cleansed, as ordered. Were my methods too subtle for you?

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Look at her. The True Soul Minthara you knew is gone.

30.speaker: Questioner Sumera
30.text: She does look a little... vacant, sister.

1.speaker: Questioner Jasin
1.text: No more anger, no more doubt. She is perfect.

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *All it takes is a thought, and Minthara's essence dissolves. You are released from her mind.*
126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mental landscape fades, Minthara falls to her knees, then fades to nothingness, leaving a white void

184.speaker: Questioner Sumera
184.text: Did you feel it, sister? The exquisite snap as her mind gave way.

0.speaker: Questioner Jasin
0.text: I did. Well done, True Soul. Minthara - how do you feel?
0.context: NodeContext: first sentence to his sister, another NPC standing nearby, second line to Minthara, who has been telepathically 'lobotomised'.

18.speaker: Questioner Sumera
18.text: We saw the memory of the pain you caused, while she was vulnerable in your arms.

45.speaker: Questioner Jasin
45.text: Her feelings for you made her weak - you were cunning to exploit them.

70.speaker: Questioner Jasin
70.text: Well done, True Soul. We will put her to work.

65.speaker: Questioner Sumera
65.text: We saw her memories of how you spoke with her. And lay with her.

85.speaker: Questioner Jasin
85.text: That bond made her vulnerable - you were cunning to exploit it.

91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
91.text: So it is you who will end me.

116.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
116.text: Make it swift, then. Anything to silence that thing - that voice.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Push past the presence, towards the drow.

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *Her torturers are not dominating her - they are destroying her mental defences, and exposing her to something else. The Absolute?*

95.speaker: Player
95.text: The only thing I'm going to break is you.

177.speaker: Questioner Sumera
177.text: Are you quite mad? Or maybe defective.

119.speaker: Questioner Jasin
119.text: You won't break us. And you won't leave here alive.

74.speaker: Questioner Jasin
74.text: We do not need assistance. Little of her remains.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Stand aside. I'm taking charge here.

89.speaker: Questioner Sumera
89.text: Yes - your authority is great. We can learn, watching you break what little remains of her mind.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: they stand back from Minthara at the end of this line

34.speaker: Questioner Jasin
34.text: There is little left to take charge of. We have already pushed her mind to the brink - the task is ours to finish.

96.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: looking up at the playerNodeContext: to player, sad, desperate

183.speaker: Questioner Jasin
183.text: You're the one she slept beside? Oh, excellent. You open the wound, and we shall press.

71.speaker: Questioner Sumera
71.text: She will not be utterly destroyed. What is useful shall remain.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Is this really wise? She's a valuable asset.

122.speaker: Questioner Sumera
122.text: Wilful, though. But you are right - whatever is useful, we will leave intact.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: This ends now - and so do you.

16.speaker: Questioner Sumera
16.text: A challenge, sister. Who would be so bold?

25.speaker: Questioner Jasin
25.text: Offal, sister. Meat that doesn't yet know it is dead.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I hope her punishment won't be too severe - she tried her best.
